name: Jeehoon Kang
content: Jeehoon Kang (강지훈) - KAIST CP The concurrency and parallelism laboratory is shut down. After 6.5 beautiful years at KAIST, I moved to FuriosaAI Research to search for the “right” abstractions for AI accelerators. I was a Tenure-Track Associate Professor at the KAIST School of Computing and the Principal Investigator at the Concurrency and Parallelism Laboratory. I also served as an adjunct faculty at the Graduate School of AI Semiconductor, the Department of Semiconductor System Engineering, and the Graduate School of Quantum Science and Technology. I earned my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Seoul National University, where I was advised by Prof. Chung-Kil Hur (supervisor) and Prof. Kwangkeun Yi (mentor). I was passionate about searching for the “right” abstraction for concurrency and parallelism. My research focused on the design and verification of concurrent and parallel systems, from micro-architectures to programming languages and algorithms. I aimed to significantly improve performance and reduce power consumption in these systems, which is essential for today’s AI-driven world.
